entity.name: Greek - Apollo
entity.subtitle: God of Light, Music, Prophecy, and Healing
entity.description: The most Greek of gods, Apollo embodies the ideals of kouros (beautiful youth), artistic excellence, rational thought, and divine order. As sun god, prophet, healer, and musician, he represents the civilized arts that elevate humanity above mere survival.

relationships.allies: Artemis(twin sister, closest relationship), theMuses(he leads their choir), Asclepius (son, untilZeuskilled him), Leto (mother, whom he fiercely protects),Dionysus(half-brother, contrasting yet complementary)
relationships.enemies: Marsyas (flayed for hubris), Python (slain at Delphi), those who insult his mother Leto or sisterArtemis(Niobe's children killed for Niobe's boast), Paris (supported Trojans in revenge for Trojan disrespect)

family.consorts: Never married; numerous lovers including Daphne (transformed to laurel), Cassandra (priestess of Troy), Coronis (mother of Asclepius), Cyrene (mother of Aristaeus), Hyacinthus (Spartan prince)
family.children: Asclepius (god of medicine, from Coronis), Aristaeus (rustic god, from Cyrene), Orpheus (legendary musician, possiblyApollo's son), Ion (ancestor of Ionians), and various others
family.siblings: Artemis(twin sister, born just beforeApollo), plus allZeus's other children includingAthena,Hermes,Dionysus,Ares

archetype.name: ‚òÄÔ∏è SUN GOD
archetype.description: Apollo embodies the Sun God archetype - bringer of light, truth, and divine order through prophecy, music, and healing.
